Ok...I downloaded all of the JavaScript unit test packages off of 
xprogramming, and I think the one from http://www.edwardh.com/jsunit/ 
might do the trick.

Thanks again!

-Eric

--- In junit@y..., "ericheikkila" <ericheikkila@y...> wrote:
> Ah...let's see....(writing from memory as the code is at home and 
I'm 
> at work)...
> 
> All I know currently is that I need to place a certain object into 
a 
> JSObject, the pass this JSObject to my class (so it can then pull 
it 
> out and do what it needs to do).  I believe the class I'm trying to 
> test will be extending Applet, if that helps.  As far as which 
> JavaScript environment...not sure I understand what you mean by 
that, 
> but I'll probably be targeting IE 5.5+ and NS 6.0+ as far as 
browser 
> compatibility goes.
> 
> As to which JSUnit I downloaded...I didn't know there were that 
> many...I'll have to go take a look at them. :)
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> -Eric
